unnormalised: Okay, so you're asking about finding good property listings in Mumbai, right? Well, first off, check out sites like Magicbricks, 99acres, and Housing.com. They usually have a bunch of flats, apartments, and even houses for sale or rent, all listed with details like "2 BHK", "3 BHK", or even "1 RK". You'll also see addresses like "Flat no. 101, Sai Apartment, Linking Road, Bandra (W), Mumbai - 400050" so you know exactly where it is.
normalised: Okay, so you're asking about finding good property listings in Mumbai, right? Well, first off, check out sites like Magicbricks, ninety nine acres, and Housing dot com. They usually have a bunch of flats, apartments, and even houses for sale or rent, all listed with details like "two B H K", "three B H K", or even "one R K". You'll also see addresses like "Flat number one hundred and one, Sai Apartment, Linking Road, Bandra west, Mumbai - four hundred thousand and fifty" so you know exactly where it is.

unnormalised: Another thing to keep in mind is the location. Places like Andheri (E) or Borivali (W) might be cheaper than, say, Bandra or Juhu. But you gotta factor in travel time, esp. if you're working in somewhere like Nariman Point. Pay attention to things like how close it is to the station or bus stop. Google Maps is your friend! It even shows walking distance in minutes (e.g. "10 min walk to station").
normalised: Another thing to keep in mind is the location. Places like Andheri east or Borivali west might be cheaper than, say, Bandra or Juhu. But you gotta factor in travel time, especially if you're working in somewhere like Nariman Point. Pay attention to things like how close it is to the station or bus stop. Google Maps is your friend! It even shows walking distance in minutes (e.g. "ten minute walk to station").

unnormalised: Finally, don’t just rely on online listings. Talk to local brokers – they often have listings that haven’t made it online yet. Also, always visit the property in person, no matter how good it looks in the pictures. Check for things like water pressure, lift maintenance, and security. And negotiate, bhai! The listed price (e.g., "Rs. 1.5 Cr onwards") is almost always negotiable, especially if you're paying in cash. Good luck finding your dream home!
normalised: Finally, don’t just rely on online listings. Talk to local brokers – they often have listings that haven’t made it online yet. Also, always visit the property in person, no matter how good it looks in the pictures. Check for things like water pressure, lift maintenance, and security. And negotiate, bhai! The listed price (e.g., "rupees one point five crore onwards") is almost always negotiable, especially if you're paying in cash. Good luck finding your dream home!
